nodes.bodyText: This is not cheap and will be called very frequently. I think we should have a condition on the caller and if a secondary index doesn't exist then shouldn;t be called. Its much cleaner than calling it and "implementing a no-op"

It is already there 
  
    
      CorfuDB/runtime/src/main/java/org/corfudb/runtime/collections/CorfuTable.java
    
    
         Line 274
      in
      671c555
    
    
    
    

        
          
           if (!secondaryIndexes.isEmpty()) { 
        
    
  


The if condition checks if an old value is present, if not (which means value == null) then we don't do anything.

Hi
If the table has secondary index, the secondaryIndexes is not empty when the table is created. But when secondaryIndexes is not empty, if a new record with key value is created, e.g. in put method, V previous = mainMap.put(key, value); the previous value is null. so the method unmapSecondaryIndexes  is still invoked and the log will be printed. I think it would be better to check value null before invoke unmapSecondaryIndexes.

@muren102 unmapSecondaryIndexes called by many methods. If I extract this check from the method I need to add it to all caller methods, which is not so good decision. Can you please explain why calling a method is a problem?

Hi
Calling the method is not a problem. But it may bring lots of trace logs "Attempting to build an index with a null value, skipping."
I still don't see how it can be a problem. Anyways we decided to get rid of it
